articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Mongolian Personage
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Mongolian Personage
Pyongyang, November 23 (KCNA) -- Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un received a gift from the chairman of the Mongolia-Korea Friendship Parliamentary Group on a visit to the DPRK.
					 The gift was conveyed to an official concerned by Chairman Baasankhuu Oktyabri on Thursday.

articles.title: An Tong Chun Meets Mongolian Guests
articles.content:
An Tong Chun Meets Mongolian Guests
Pyongyang, November 23 (KCNA) -- An Tong Chun, vice-chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK on Thursday had a talk with  Baasankhuu Oktyabri, chairman of the Mongolia-Korea Friendship Parliamentary Group, and his party who paid a courtesy call on him, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.

articles.title: Mongolian Embassy Here Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Mongolian Embassy Here Hosts Reception
Pyongyang, November 23 (KCNA) -- The Mongolian embassy here on Thursday hosted a reception at Pyongyang Koryo Hotel to mark the 93rd anniversary of the proclamation of the People's Republic of Mongolia.
					 Present there on invitation were Thae Hyong Chol, president of Kim Il Sung University and concurrently minister of Higher Education who is chairman of the DPRK-Mongolia Friendship Parliamentary Group, Vice-Foreign Minister Ri Kil Song, Pak Kyong Il, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and chairman of the DPRK-Mongolia Friendship Association, officials concerned and foreign diplomatic envoys and representatives of international organizations here.
					
					 Ambassador Suren Tsoggerel and staff members of the Mongolian embassy and Baasankhuu Oktyabri, chairman of the Mongolia-Korea Friendship Parliamentary Group, and his party were on hand.
					
					 Speeches were made there.

articles.title: European Politicians Leave
articles.content:
European Politicians Leave
Pyongyang, November 23 (KCNA) -- A delegation of politicians from various political parties of Europe led by Chief Executive Officer of Inter Mediate Jonathan Powell left here on Thursday.

articles.title: Delegations of Juche Idea Study Organizations Leave
articles.content:
Delegations of Juche Idea Study Organizations Leave
Pyongyang, November 23 (KCNA) -- Juche idea followers of different countries on Thursday left here after taking part in the Third National Conference of Social Scientists.
					 They are a delegation of the Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea led by Advisor Garib Newaz, a delegation of the Mongolian Mt Paektu Association for Independent Development led by D. Enkhbadralt who is a member of its Leadership Council, Alexandr Vorontsov, vice-chairman of the Russian Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and DPRK's Policy, Economy and Culture, and his party, Edmond Jouve, director-general of the European Society for the Study of the Juche Idea, Andre Lohekele Kalonda, secretary general of the African Regional Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, and Omar Lopez, chairman of the Venezuelan National Society for the Study of the Juche Idea.
					
					 Departing earlier were Harish Gupta, vice director-general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, and his party, Takao Kamakura, director of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, and his party and scholars of various Chinese social science institutes and universities.

articles.title: Foreigners, Koreans in Japan Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
Foreigners, Koreans in Japan Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
Pyongyang, November 23 (KCNA) -- The chairman of the Mongolia-Korea Friendship Parliamentary Group, and his party and a delegation of the Korean Social Scientists Association in Japan on Thursday visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun.
					 They paid tribute to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il before their statues.
					
					 They paid homage to the great leaders in the halls where they lie in state.
					
					 They went round the halls where the orders the great leaders received are on display and the halls which house the cars, electric car, boat and train coaches used by them for their field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of their lives.

articles.title: National Sci-Tech Presentation in Field of Biology Held
articles.content:
National Sci-Tech Presentation in Field of Biology Held
Pyongyang, November 23 (KCNA) -- A national scientific and technological presentation in the field of biology was held at the Bioengineering Branch of the State Academy of Sciences on Wednesday and Thursday under the sponsorship of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Science and Technology of Korea.
					 It was attended by officials, scientists, technicians, teachers, researchers and postgraduates from Kim Il Sung University, Kim Hyong Jik University of Education, the State Academy of Sciences, the Institute of Agricultural Science and other units.
					
					 The presentation was divided into panels of bioengineering, biology, botany, zoology and microbiology. It heard more than 250 papers. 
					
					 The participants introduced the experience gained in the work to turn out cutting-edge bionic products and put into practice the achievements of modern biology in the fields of agriculture, medical science and food industry.
					
					 Also introduced were achievements made in scientific researches to routinely check species of animals and plants and their living conditions, protect species of biology including rare animals and plants, and ensure diversity of biology.

articles.title: Pyongyang Citizens Enraged at U.S. Hostility towards DPRK
articles.content:
Pyongyang Citizens Enraged at U.S. Hostility towards DPRK
Pyongyang, November 23 (KCNA) -- Upon receiving the statement issued by a spokesman for the Korea Asia-Pacific Peace Committee to reject the re-listing of the DPRK as a "state sponsor of terrorism", citizens in Pyongyang express their towering indignation against old lunatic Trump and the U.S., the empire of gangsters.
					 Han Kuk Hyok, a resident in Rangnang District, told KCNA:
					
					 My country is a dignified peace-loving country which has consistently opposed all forms of terrorism and any support to it.
					
					 It is none other than the U.S., kingpin of international terrorism, which has openly engaged itself in subversion, murder, ravage and plunder across the world and even instigated anti-government forces to bring down legal governments that go against its will.
					
					 As long as there exists the U.S. in the world, the global peace and security are only a daydream. Therefore, such human scum like Trump are deserved to be exterminated on the earth.
					
					 Pang Chol Ung, a resident in Songyo District, said:
					
					 It is no longer pardonable that old lunatic Trump and his clique committed another hideous political provocation against the DPRK.
					
					 Our deep-rooted indignation against Yankees is sky-scrapping. 
					
					 The more persistent old lunatic Trump remains in his hostility against the DPRK, the stronger our people's retaliatory will grows.
					
					 Under the leadership of the great Workers' Party of Korea, our people-centered socialism will continue to advance and our state nuclear force shall be brought to earlier perfection.
					
					 Trump and American warmongers had better to be clearly aware of whom their rival is and that no frantic move can work on our people.

articles.title: Number of Synthetic Grass Producers on Increase
articles.content:
Number of Synthetic Grass Producers on Increase
Pyongyang, November 23 (KCNA) -- A process for the production of synthetic grass was newly established at the Pyongyang Kim Jong Suk Textile Mill in the DPRK.
					 The mill made every part of the process with its own efforts and technology.
					
					 Its synthetic grass is high in quality indices and good in elasticity, according to a test result.
					
					 The production process would be conducive to developing sports and face-lifting educational condition and environment.
					
					 When going round a football training ground in November Juche 102 (2013), respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un gave an instruction to build a base for mass-producing quality synthetic grass.
					
					 Other synthetic grass production processes were already installed at the Wonsan Disabled Soldiers' Essential Plastic Goods Factory, Hamhung Woolen Mill and the Phyongchon Disabled Soldiers' Daily Necessities Factory.

articles.title: Compatible Agent for Recycling Plastic Waste Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
Compatible Agent for Recycling Plastic Waste Developed in DPRK
Pyongyang, November 23 (KCNA) -- Pyongyang Han Tok Su University of Light Industry in the DPRK recently developed a compatible agent for recycling plastic waste.
					 The compatible agent for recycling plastic waste would be conducive to putting the production on a normal basis at plastic goods producers and preventing the environmental pollution.
					
					 A research group of the university settled such sci-tech problems arising in recycling plastic waste as ascertaining the components of plastic waste and their properties and lowering the boundary tension between each component and thus developed the compatible agent.
					
					 And it also manufactured equipment for producing master-batch.
					
					 The Pyongyang Daily Necessities Factory, Pyongyang Cornstarch Factory, Pyongyang Pharmaceutical Factory and others have introduced the compatible agent into production to create a great quantity of raw material reserves, while increasing the variety of goods and productivity.

articles.title: Minju Joson Slams S. Korean Authorities for War Moves
articles.content:
Minju Joson Slams S. Korean Authorities for War Moves
Pyongyang, November 23 (KCNA) -- Minju Joson in a commentary Thursday denounces the south Korean puppet regime for getting frantic with introduction of U.S. military equipment and development of arms allegedly to increase the "capability of conducting a war independently" and step up the "modernization of defence industry".
					 Such military confrontation moves will further aggravate the tense situation of the Korean peninsula and disturb the regional peace and stability, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 The danger of a nuclear war now lingers on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 The south Korean authorities are getting hell-bent on the joint anti-DPRK war exercises with the U.S. while pushing ahead with purchase of U.S.-made weapons and the development of military equipment. This more clearly reveals their true colors as war servants of the U.S. master and fratricidal war maniacs.
					
					 It is the wicked intention of the U.S. to sell more weapons to south Korea under the pretence of "threat from the north" and equip south Korea with U.S. weapons and use it as a shock brigade in a war against the DPRK.
					
					 Nevertheless, the south Korean authorities are keen to bring greater profits to the American munitions monopoly plutocrats and actively join in the moves of the U.S. master for a war of aggression with a huge amount of money collected from the people as taxes to curry favor with stingy trader and warmonger Trump. They are, indeed, poor colonial servants of the U.S. as they provide the master with gallbladder and liver.
					
					 Those who have gone so reckless as to hurt the fellow countrymen in the north with the backing of outside forces are vociferating about "threat" and "provocation" by someone. This is just like a guilty party filing the suit first.
					
					 The south Korean puppet authorities would be well advised to ponder over the catastrophic consequences to be entailed by their imprudent arms buildup. They should not run amuck depending on the scarecrow-like U.S.

articles.title: S. Korean Broadcasting Service on Wretched Plight of Old Persons
articles.content:
S. Korean Broadcasting Service on Wretched Plight of Old Persons
Pyongyang, November 23 (KCNA) -- The number of old persons who die while living lonely without any care by their children and social protection is on the steady increase across south Korea, according to its KBS on Nov. 20.
					 It urged the "government" to take a necessary step to tackle the problem.

articles.title: S. Koreans Stage Actions against THAAD Deployment
articles.content:
S. Koreans Stage Actions against THAAD Deployment
Pyongyang, November 23 (KCNA) -- Members of organizations of various circles, inhabitants of Songju County in North Kyongsang Province and Won Buddhists of south Korea reportedly staged protest actions against the regime's project for building a THAAD base on Nov. 21.
					 Upon receiving the news about the authorities' move to transport equipment for the project, more than one hundred protesters blocked the road to the base in token of resistance.
					
					 More than 5 000 policemen deployed near the base violently put down their protest actions and dispersed the crowd.
					
					 That day the All-People Action for Checking THAAD Deployment released a statement censuring the introduction of equipment and the police's violence against the demonstrators.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Uganda
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Uganda
Pyongyang, November 23 (KCNA) -- A Ugandan national committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed in Kampala on Nov. 9.
					 Kirunda Kivejinja, second vice prime minister of Uganda, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The remembrance committee decided to organize political and cultural events including seminar, remembrance meeting and lecture on the sixth anniversary of demise of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Congo
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Congo
Pyongyang, November 23 (KCNA) -- A Congolese committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed on Nov. 15.
					 Vital Balla, chairman of the Congolese Association for Friendship among Peoples, was elected chairman of the remembrance committee.
					
					 The committee decided to give wide publicity to Kim Jong Il's revolutionary career and exploits and organize political and cultural events including remembrance meeting and film show on the sixth anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: Minju Joson condena intento de introducir equipos militares de EE.UU. en Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Minju Joson condena intento de introducir equipos militares de EE.UU. en Sur de Corea
Pyongyang, 23 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Ultimamente, los titeres surcoreanos tratan de introducir los equipos militares de fabricacion norteamericana y desarrollar los armamentos propios abogando por la "capacidad de hacer la guerra de manera independiente" y la "modernizacion de defensa".
					Estas tentativas devienen otro demencial acto de confrontacion militar que agrava la ya tensa situacion de la Peninsula Coreana y perturba la paz y estabilidad de la region.
					
					Asi senala el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual difundido este jueves y prosigue:
					
					Ahora, la Peninsula Coreana corre el tremendo peligro de guerra nuclear.
					
					Al paralelo de los ejercicios de guerra anti-Norte, los titeres surcoreanos estan enfrascados en comprar equipos belicos de EE.UU. y desarrollar armamentos por cuenta propia, hecho que deja conocer su naturaleza de lacayos a cargo de cumplir la guerra deseada por su amo gringo y de maniacos de enfrentamiento fratricida.
					
					Vender muchas armas al Sur de Corea so pretexto de la "amenaza nuclear del Norte" y usarlo como brigada de choque en la eventual guerra de agresion contra la RPDC luego de equiparlo con armas norteamericanas, esto es la siniestra intencion de EE.UU.
					
					Para adular a Trump, comerciante y maniaco de guerra, los lacayos coloniales enriquecen a los monopolios belicos estadounidenses con los impuestos recaudados al pueblo y toman parte activa en la campana de guerra de EE.UU.
					
					Es muy absurdo que esos tipejos cuestionaran tanto la "amenaza" y "provocacion" de alguien.
					
					Los titeres surcoreanos deben reflexionar de las consecuencias catastroficas que produzca el aumento armamentista, en lugar de actuar con temeridad confiando en su fanfarroneado patron gringo.

articles.title: Medios rusos presentan el orgullo de cientificos coreanos
articles.content:
Medios rusos presentan el orgullo de cientificos coreanos
Pyongyang, 23 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El periodico ruso Zavtra fechado 13 publico un articulo intitulado "Orgullo excepcional de los cosmologos coreanos" adjuntando las fotos del Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un.
					Los cosmologos coreanos se sienten orgullosos de encontrarse en la cima del mundo, comenzo el texto.
					
					Prosiguio que eso no significa la altura geografica, sino el inmenso amor y confianza que les dispensa el Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un.
					
					Bajo su guia, ellos crecieron como los fuertes espirituales que no se rinden ante las dificultades y fracasos y marchan adelante con la pasion ilimitada y elevados conocimientos cientifico-tecnicos con que pueden desafiar al cosmos, recalco.
					
					El periodico presento en detalles la direccion esmerada del Mariscal sobre el desarrollo espacial del pais.
					
					Concluyo destacando que bajo su direccion, los cosmologos coreanos trabajan con todo empeno para alcanzar la meta mas alta.
					
					La revista online Lemchich y las paginas Web Patrioti Moskva y "RPDC de hoy" publicaron los dias 13 y 14 los articulos bajo titulares de "Lugar mas alto del mundo" y otros junto con las fotos de la insignia de la Administracion Nacional de Desarrollo Aeroespacial de la RPDC, el Centro de Control General de Satelites, el lanzamiento de satelite de observacion de la Tierra "Kwangmyongsong-4" y los cientificos cosmicos.
